render.text:
10 THINGS ROCK STARS CAN DO THAT OTHER PEOPLE CAN'T

 

Ever wondered what it’s like to live the life of a famous rock star? Being on tour, playing on stages all over the world, being admired by fans and cheered on by a huge crowd – but that’s not even all! We made the ultimate list of all the things that rock stars get away with.

 

YOU CAN TAKE AS MUCH VACATION AS YOU WANT TO

Most rock stars tour a lot or spend their time off-tour in the studio, but that’s also because it’s what they love doing! Famous musicians have the possibility to take some time off whenever they feel like and can actually spend months on vacation, see exotic places and find inspiration for new material. Spending time at beautiful beaches and relaxing without a care is definitely one of the best perks of being a rock star!

 

IF YOU THROW YOURSELF INTO THE CROWD, THEY WILL ACTUALLY CATCH YOU

What's a rock concert without proper crowd-surfing? Unfortunately, only the people on stage can really be sure to get caught. The fans will be thrilled to touch you and you could surf the wave of hundreds of loving arms that hand you to one another. That’s the real life of a rock star.

 

YOU DON'T HAVE TO THINK ABOUT WHAT ANYTHING COSTS (BECAUSE YOU ARE PROBABLY RICH)

Life is expensive, especially when it comes to all the shiny, fun things! Most people have to save money to fulfill their dreams, buy a new car or a house, but not a rock star. The irony of it all is that you get loads of stuff for free when you’re rich and famous. Companies want you to wear their clothes, drink their coffee and use their equipment without payment. Sounds pretty sweet, no?

YOU CAN ORDER ANY FOOD ANY TIME OF THE DAY

Rock stars are touring the world all the time and stay in fancy hotels around the globe. These privileges include the best room services you can think of. Ever craved lasagna or lobster in the middle of the night? You could just pick up the phone and call someone who'll prepare it for you asap. Really doesn’t get better than that.

 

NOBODY WILL BE MAD AT YOU WHEN YOU HAVE A BAD DAY AT WORK

Woke up in a bad mood? Not when you are a rock star cause everybody’s here to cater to you regardless. Nobody will get in your way if you don’t feel like doing something. You can show people your emotions and they will probably celebrate your honest attitude that makes you more human and authentic. After all, emotions are what inspires rock stars to write their next great hit.

 

YOU NEVER HAVE TO STAND IN LINE FOR ANYTHING

Waiting is one of the most annoying and time consuming activities. Waiting in the store, coffee shop or at the hair dresser even though you have an appointment. But guess what? Someone else will do it for you. When you are famous your assistants pick up all the stuff you want or you just get it delivered directly to you without even having to ask.

YOU CAN WEAR WHATEVER YOU WANT

Rock stars care about their appearance, no doubt. A certain extravagancy when it comes to their fashion choices is probably even expected. But when it boils down to it, they can really get away with anything, no matter how out of line or outrageously hideous it is they put on their backs. Guess what, as a musician can dictate what’s in! On the other hand, it’s hard to believe that anyone will copy your style when you go out in pajamas to buy milk from the grocery store around the corner.

 

YOU ALWAYS GET THE COOLEST NEW KICKS FIRST

When you’re famous, you are basically seen as a wandering billboard. Everything you wear becomes cool, because you are cool! Brands will send you their stuff for free in the hopes that you’ll wear it and therefore other people buy it. It’s a pretty good deal if you want to take it.

 

NOBODY GETS MAD IF YOU BREAK SOMETHING

Ever dreamed of smashing a guitar, TV or smartphone? No problemo when you're famous! You simply buy another one and probably even get applauded for it. We know all the stories of musicians destroying things, it's kind of their job if you think about it. Of course we wouldn't want you to destroy the furniture of whole hotel rooms but when you’re famous, chances are that you can pay for it without even thinking about it.

YOU KNOW ALL THE OTHER FAMOUS ROCK STARS

Rock stars love to party with like-minded people that aren't freaked out by their success. Of course other famous people are perfect for that. You'd meet each other at award shows, hang out backstage at huge festivals and have the biggest stars as friends in cities around the globe. You'd know all the real stories apart from gossip in tabloids and live the life so many dream of.

preview.text: 10 THINGS ROCK STARS CAN DO THAT OTHER PEOPLE CAN'T

render.text:
No two sports teams are alike. In fact, unique style and raw talent is what earns most teams their triumph. But regardless of what sport – basketball, football, baseball or even dodgeball – successful teams have the same underlying characteristics that lead them to victory.

 

Leadership

Winning teams have a strong leader. Whether that guy or gal is the team captain, coach or manager, having a strong figure at front and centre is critical to a team’s success. Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant pushed their teams to win multiple NBA championships. Sure, they’re both insanely talented, but these legends led by example and were vocal motivators - what makes them two of the great NBA leaders in history.

Discipline

It may look effortless on TV, but winning is hard work. And hard work requires discipline. Intense practice sessions, good diet, critical thinking – winning teams can’t let themselves slip. During off-season, athletes discipline themselves to stay in top physical condition. On the field, they need to have the discipline to stick to team strategies.


Preparation

Successful sports teams are ready for any challenge. Joe Girardi, the manager of New York Yankees baseball team, once said: “If you think too much, you’ll fail, because the game happens too quickly. The key is preparation and the data has to become instinctual.” His technique is to prepare his team so well that they don’t have to think in the middle of the pitch. The next move just comes to them instinctively.


Communication

If you watch any good basketball team, you’ll notice they’re constantly talking to each other; helping one another, strategizing about the next move, and shouting praise. And before they get out there, the team leader – usually the coach – needs to communicate the game plan. A clearly communicated plan and pep-talk before the game and on the court is a must.

 

Teamwork

Teamwork is a clichéd and overused term, but it’s critical. Leicester City stunned everyone winning the English Premiere League last season, largely riding on the power of their teamwork. While Leicester had talented players, none of them were superstars. There may be hierarchies and specific leaders within a team, but successful teams are built on respect and togetherness. After all, how would Messi shoot if he wasn’t being passed the ball?

Appreciation

Sir Alex Ferguson, the legendary coach of Manchester United, has said: “Few people get better with criticism; most respond to encouragement instead.” Everyone loves a pat on the back! Even your favourite footballer.

Honesty

Bill Parcells is a former NFL head coach with teams like the New York Giants and Dallas Cowboys on his resume. He is famous for turning around underperforming teams and he does so with brutal honesty. He once wrote: “You have to tell them the truth about their performance, you have to tell it to them face-to-face, and you to tell it to them over and over again.” He stresses that teams should communicate honestly and in the clearest possible way if they hope to achieve success.


Attitude

A winning attitude leads to – you guessed it – winning. The Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli knows this. He has said he strives to create “winning habits” in his team. “And you know, winning is contagious,” he said. Attitude is everything, if you’ve got the right mindset, you’re one step closer to the prize!


Clarity

Every team – sports or otherwise – works best when people know what’s expected of them. One role isn’t necessarily more important than the other; it’s just different. When teams play to their strengths, they win. Like in the latest European Championship, Portugal snatched a surprise victory even though they struggled through the group stages. Their winning secret: well-defined roles. While the team struggled for goals, they were clear about their roles in building an effective defense.

 

Good Health

Maintaining good health is key for successful teams. Winning teams take time to recover from injuries and only put those players on the field who are top condition. Sir Alex Ferguson has noted: “Sometimes I could tell a player was injured when he thought he was fine.” As well as being physically in tact, players also need to be healthy from the inside out with good diets and nutrition - after all, fitness starts in the kitchen!


Love for the team 

This is perhaps the most defining characteristic of winning teams. A team that has fun together, stays together. And a team that stays together, wins together. Welsh football team captain Gareth Bale said: “Playing for Wales is like playing with my friends.” And as friends, they impressed everyone at Euros 2016, putting on a great performance.

So there you have it – the recipe for success! Next time you're watching your favourite team, see if you can spot these 10 habits, or try to implement them into your own team. See you at the grand final!

THE STORIES BEHIND THE MOST ICONIC RAP VIDEOS

There are several things that are really important in rap music. The beat, the rhymes, the melody, the message are all equal parts of what makes a good track, but also the music videos have been getting more and more important as rap superstars are looking for a way to support their music visually. We give you a quick rundown of the most iconic rap videos of the past and their background stories!

JAY-Z – 99 PROBLEMS

99 PROBLEMS is not your ordinary music video, it truly is a piece of art. It was shot around the area in Brooklyn, where JAY-Z grew up and has a lot of auto-biographical references. They recorded the video on black-and-white film which provides an authentic look with visual characteristics that strongly resemble New York street photography. JAY-Z wanted the video to be as raw and authentic as the rest of his masterpiece “The Black Album”, which is now rightfully one of the most influential rap albums of recent music history.

DRAKE – WORST BEHAVIOR

WORST BEHAVIOR is one of Drake’s most famous songs, also thanks to its iconic video that takes us through his father’s home town, Memphis, Tennessee. We go through parking lots of fast food chains, see some classy, old men with their pimped cars and a pretty upset Drake, that keeps asking “Remember?” The local music scene had a huge influence on his music just like his dad, who also plays a part in the video! He is the main pimp, rapping along with Drake’s lyrics, while dancing in the most genuinely cool way we’ve seen in a really long time. The man knows all the right moves. It’s really worth watching the whole 10 minutes but there is also a shorter, edited version.

KANYE WEST – BOUND 2

BOUND 2 is the final track on KANYE WESTs album YEEZUS which also made headlines due to the controversy surrounding the video. The video shows beautiful, almost corny landscapes alongside shots of Kanye riding a motorcycle, wild horses, and soaring eagles. Critics were divided between proclaiming it genius or crap, but let’s be honest, we all know how much Yeezy loves to polarize. It has been parodied on numerous occasions, which shows its great significance and influence on pop culture.

IGGY AZALEA – WORK

 

WORK was the debut single as a lead artist of mega rap star IGGY AZALEA. The lyrics and video tell the biographical story of IGGY who rose up from her underclass upbringing to become a world star. She worked hard to be known and raps about the discrimination she was confronted with as a female rapper. Iggy moved to the US shortly before her 16th birthday after telling her parents that she would go on vacation with a friend and ended up staying. “No money, no family, 16 in the middle of Miami” sounds tough but Iggy persevered and is now one of the leading rap stars in the game!

THE WEEKND – CAN'T FEEL MY FACE

Abel Makkonen Tesfaye a.k.a. THE WEEKND released CAN'T FEEL MY FACE in 2015 as part of his famed, second studio album BEAUTY BEHIND THE MADNESS. The simple, yet surprising video reveals Abel’s striking dance moves. THE WEEKND performs in a late night club for a very unimpressed audience but stays focused on his show, even when someone throws a drink at him. In the end he literally catches fire but still keeps on dancing while the crowd finally starts rocking out. Abel’s unusually energetic routine adds a great deal to this weirdly great video.

DRE – FORGOT ABOUT DRE

If you ever wondered what happens if you get into a fight with DR. DRE, this video will give you all the answers. Nobody’s safe from Dre’s revenge when he lets his Pitbull Eminem loose – not even an old lady. In the censored version the explicit rap part of EMINEM was replaced by a TV reporter asking him questions as a witness to the fire he set himself. Once more we see The Real Slim Shady in action and reminds us what an incredible dream team EMINEM and DRE were.

EMINEM – THE REAL SLIM SHADY

THE REAL SLIM SHADY is a hymn to EMINEM’s violent alter ego Slim Shady. The video is set in a psychiatric ward, a fast food store and a factory which produces numerous EMINEM clones. Apart from that we see EMINEMs wacky side, dressed in a superhero costume and making fun of celebrities. Here’s the part you didn’t know: The TV channels didn't want to play the video uncensored, so there is an even nastier version of it out there! By the way there are lots of parodies of the song and video but Eminem knows that if can you dish it out, you also have to take it.

NELLY – HOT IN HERRE

It’s hard to believe that HOT IN HERRE will celebrate its 15th birthday in a few months! It was the first song ever to win a Grammy Award for Best Male Rap Solo Performance and shows the party life of a rap star that we all dream of: fast cars, hot people and great music. It features cameo appearances by a comedian, as well as famous NBA and NFL players. Did you know NELLY made an alternative video that was shown on MTV Europe? It was shot at the Gateway Arch in St. Louis, which represents Nelly’s hometown.

BEASTIE BOYS – SABOTAGE

This is probably the oldest video on our list, but it is a real classic. It parodies classic crime thrillers made famous in the 70s and hilariously features the three members in bad suits and fake mustaches. SABOTAGE is a fictional police show, introducing the band as made-up actors chasing bad guys in a row of ridiculous stunt scenes. The video was a huge success and still a favorite among fans. For their video anthology they even shot a mock interview of the cast of SABOTAGE.

preview.text: THE STORIES BEHIND THE MOST ICONIC RAP VIDEOS

render.text:
BANDS OF NEW YORK – A BRIEF HISTORY

New York is the city that never sleeps and has a lot of cool things to offer. The city is full of interesting artists, writers, musicians, who work to the beat of this pulsating melting pot of unconventional ideas and inspirational places. New York’s clubs and bars are filled with aspiring musicians, waiting to step into the footsteps of so many bands before them who were discovered on small stages and backyards. We give you a little round up of the coolest bands that were founded and discovered in this exciting city.

YEAH YEAH YEAHS

The indie rock scene wouldn't be complete without the YEAH YEAH YEAHS. Pianist and vocalist Karen O and drummer Brian Chase met at College in Ohio where they lived before going to New York. Karen met guitar and keyboard player Nick Zinner in a New York local bar and formed the YEAH YEAH YEAHS with him in 2000. Brian joined after the first drummer quit. Their arty punk style shook things up in the music industry. Songs like "Maps" defined the sound of the young millennium!

BLONDIE

These rock legends caused a great stir in the new wave and punk scene in the 1970s. The moment we hear the band name, a picture of singer Debbie Harry with her blonde trademark hair pops up in our head. Did you know that her appearance really was the reason they called themselves Blondie? The complete line-up of the band changed over the years but gave us memorable hits, such as "Heart of Glass", "One way of another" and "Call me". They broke up in 1982 but reformed in 1996 and are still touring and releasing today after more than 40 years in business.

THE RAPTURE

This trio never was an ordinary rock band. When starting out in 1998 their sound was as unique as their mix of genres from dance, post-punk, disco and electronica, which created songs such as "House of Jealous Lovers", "How deep is your Love?" and "Pieces of the people we love". Even the line-up was unusual and changed a lot and eventually led to the former quartet becoming a trio. Even though they never officially announced it, rumor has it that they broke up in 2014, but with this band you can never know for sure.

BEASTIE BOYS

Another group that started out as a quartet but later became a trio. The BEASTIE BOYS formed in 1981, originally as a hardcore punk band! When they released an experimental Hip Hop 12-inch record a year later they found their big love for Hip Hop and Rap Rock. Good for us, their influence on the whole scene cannot be emphasized enough. The Rolling Stone and VH1 ranked them on their lists of the 100 Greatest Artists of All Time. Unfortunately, they stopped recording in 2012 after gifting the world with eight studio albums and tunes like "(You Gotta) Fight For Your Right (To Party)".

SONIC YOUTH

Finding the perfect band name might take some time. So when guitarist Thurston Moore and Kim Gordon started making music together they called themselves "Male Bonding", "Red Milk" and "The Arcadians" before finally settling on SONIC YOUTH in 1981. From that day on their characteristic sound came to life and they became huge alternative icons in the 90s. They continued to successfully make records up until 2011 and have influenced a myriad of bands through their impressive oeuvre.

TV ON THE RADIO

This avant-garde, indie rock band was founded in 2001. They are not only known for cool tunes but also for their great sense of humor. Naming their demo album "OK Calculator" – a reference to the album title of another famous band – and their second one "Return to Cookie Mountain" was as hilarious as their songs were good. Their eclectic music mixes all kinds of styles and is heavily influenced by a long list of very diverse artists.

THE VELVET UNDERGROUND

THE VELVET UNDERGROUND was a rock band between 1964 and 1973 but they are still legends and it's impossible to imagine the history of rock music without them. Singer and guitarist Lou Reed – who himself became a music legend – formed the band with multi-instrumentalist John Cale, guitarist Sterling Morrison and drummer Angus Maclise, who was replaced by Maureen Tucker in 1965. They played a big role in New York's art scene as a house band for Andy Warhol's Factory. The eccentric artist also managed them for a short period and his famous banana pop art design is on the cover of their debut album. Unfortunately, huge commercial success never happened during their active years.

MATT AND KIM

The indie electronic duo makes the perfect upbeat dance music that always puts us in a great mood right away. Vocalist and keyboarder Matt Johnson and drum player Kim Schifino started to make music together in 2004. Their live shows and music videos are unlike anything you've ever seen! These two know great moves and they aren't called a party band by the press for nothing. Energetic Dance-Pop meets Pop-Punk with Hip Hop influences, what more could you wish for?

BRAND NEW

The rock band from Long Island was formed in 2000 by members of the local hardcore music scene. Their style became more mature over the years and evolved into Alternative Rock, Indie and Emo. So far, they released four studio albums but another one is scheduled to be released next year. Sadly, they also announced, that the band is done and will break up in 2018. So next year is all the more reason to celebrate this fantastic band and take the last chance to see them live!

preview.text: BANDS OF NEW YORK – A BRIEF HISTORY

render.text:
6 THINGS YOU MUST TRY IN THE SNOW

If you’re ready for the snow to fall, it's time you transformed your ordinary winter break into a snow-filled winter experience by changing-up your favorite snow activities. If the dropping temperatures and slushy sidewalks are already making you want retreat inside to binge watch Netflix then it's time to rethink your favorite snow traditions. Here are 6 activities you must try this winter:

1. A snowball fight (extreme edition)

Thrive in energetic atmospheres? Love a bit of healthy competition? Having a snowball fight is a great way to keep your inner-child happy and feed your competitive spirit, so why not step it up a level and create an extreme version of the game you already know and love. Build targets out of cardboard that are split up like a dartboard, each section worth a certain amount of points. Hang these from trees or stand them in the ground and split into teams. Create an arsenal of tightly packed snowballs then rocket the snowballs at your competitor’s targets. Keep a tally of the points to see who wins and even throw in a prize for the winning team (maybe hot chocolates or dibs on the first warm bath!).

2. Race to the bottom

If you enjoy the wind whipping across your face as you race down a slope at top speeds with the snow beneath your feet, then sledding is obviously already a favorite of yours. Sledding may already be a staple of the winter season, but tweak this activity to make it more fun by creating a competition to see who can race to the bottom first. Build lanes and make a bracket and see who advances to the final. And no worries if not everyone is ready with a sled on hand – garbage bags, pieces of cardboard or frisbees work great as makeshift sleds!

3. Snow is also food

Okay, maybe you’re a bit tired from all the physical activities involving snow and you’re ready for a snack-break. How about snow as food? Making snow candy is easier than going to the store – you just need to boil 2.5dl of maple syrup and .60dl of butter at medium heat for 4-5 minutes. Once the mixture has melted, slowly pour it into a cup of snow, letting it cool for a few minutes. Peel the candy from the snow then enjoy the sugary goodness! If your favorite retreat from the scorching summer heat is a snow cone, don’t wait for July - make a snow cone from real life snow! Make sure you’ve got some fruit concentrate and paper cups (to hold your snow), then pour the juice over the snowballs for a treat that's great all year round! Tip: Make sure it’s clean snow, preferably fresh and just fallen. Don’t touch the yellow snow ;)

4. Become an artist

Okay, so you’ve spent years perfecting the classic snowman, now it’s time to step it up. Creating intricate ice art or snow sculptures can be quite challenging first go, but we’ve got some pro-tips for your inner-artist to blossom. If you want to form circular ice pieces, put water inside a balloon or in a tupperware container (or ice tray for small pieces) and leave them to freeze overnight. The next day peel off the balloons or pour a little water to get the ice out of the tupperware and then stack or design however you choose. To add color and flair to your ice art, drop a little food dye in with the water in the balloons or tupperware – how about a rainbow igloo?!

5. Become a street artist

Tap into your creative side by letting the snow covered earth be your canvas and write clever messages or graffiti tags in the ice. All you need to do is buy colorful cans of spray paint at your local arts and craft stores to become an up-and-coming snow artist! For more advanced art, try using stencils or cut out shapes or designs in cardboard and paint around it. Make sure to ask permission to graffiti the area first – but the good thing about this type of graffiti is that it can be removed within seconds ;)

6. Become a scientist

If the snow is piling up around you, and you’ve used all your creative juices, played until your socks were wet and eaten enough snow to give you a brain freeze, there’s one final thing to try. Put 2dl of water on the stove and wait til it boils. When it’s ready, go outside and (super carefully) throw the water it into the freezing cold air – watch in amazement at what happens to the water. This experiment only works in temperatures colder than around -25 celsius, so wait for temperatures to really drop before trying. Also make sure the area is clear of people and pets, it is boiling water after all and some droplets can still burn you or someone else. Can you guess what happens?

So don’t let the cooler temperatures force you to become a winter hermit cooped up inside by the fireplace – head outside and enjoy the wonderful snow before it’s too late!

preview.text: 6 THINGS YOU HAVE TO TRY IN THE SNOW

render.text: Viaggiare con gli amici è un’esperienza davvero eccitante che in passato la maggior parte degli adolescenti poteva solo sognare: le spese erano troppo elevate e le possibilità di guadagnare un po’ di soldi erano poche. Oggi, grazie ai voli low cost e ai social media che ci mettono in contatto con persone in diversi Paesi, il mondo è più accessibile ai giovani e molti ne approfittano! Questa tendenza è sicuramente più forte in Europa che negli altri continenti e, se avete la fortuna di vivere qui, allora dovreste cogliere al volo l’opportunità di esplorare il mondo! Di seguito vi forniamo alcuni pratici consigli su come viaggiare in modo intelligente, anche se il vostro unico reddito è la vostra paghetta settimanale.

TROVARE UN VOLO

Se siete flessibili per quanto riguarda le date e le destinazioni, non c’è niente di più eccitante che scorrere le offerte delle compagnie aeree low cost. A seconda del periodo dell’anno e della distanza, potete trovare biglietti anche a soli 10 €! Su alcuni siti, potete addirittura inserire l’importo che avete a disposizione, un periodo indicativo in cui potreste essere disponibili a partire, ed ecco fatto! Le destinazioni potranno non essere quelle dei vostri sogni, ma se mantenete una mentalità, finirete con lo scoprire luoghi inesplorati, con pochi turisti e altrettanto belli quanto le maggiori capitali europee.

OSTELLI

Se viaggiate con un budget ridotto, la migliore soluzione è senza dubbio quella di alloggiare presso ostelli per la gioventù. Più persone ci sono in una stanza e meno si spende, quindi se viaggiate in gruppo, questa è sicuramente la soluzione perfetta! Dovrete ricordarvi di portare con voi asciugamani e articoli da toletta (e ovviamente un paio di ciabatte per le docce comuni), ma risparmierete davvero una bella somma di denaro. Gli ostelli spesso offrono una colazione gratis a base di cereali e pane, in modo da saziarvi fino a mezzogiorno, e mettono a disposizione uno spazio comune e un bar che offre sconti agli ospiti, dove potrete conoscere nuove persone! Non vi possiamo promettere che incontrerete ogni volta persone interessanti, ma sicuramente farete nuove esperienze e potrete raccontarle per il resto della vostra vita.

COSA MANGIARE

Se viaggiate in posti famosi per le loro prelibatezze, la tentazione di spendere cifre esagerate in ristoranti rinomati e mangiare qualunque cosa vediate potrebbe essere grande. Spiacenti di riportarvi alla realtà, ma in quanto viaggiatori studenti non potete permettervelo! Dunque, approfittate della colazione gratuita all’ostello per riempirvi lo stomaco. In questo modo, potreste resistere e camminare per alcune ore prima di avere bisogno di mangiare nuovamente. A pranzo, optate per una insalata o un sandwich da mangiare al parco, invece che un bar costoso. Per i vostri snack durante la giornata, procuratevi del buon cibo da strada e fatevelo bastare fino all’ora di cena. Se durante il giorno siete riusciti a risparmiare, potrete spendere un po’ di più a cena e, perché no, andare a ristorante, purché prima abbiate fatto un po’ di ricerche! Cercate i locali più vantaggiosi, che propongono happy hour e offerte prima di partire, in modo da sapere già cosa vi aspetta.

AND﻿ARE A PIEDI

La maggior parte delle città europee possono essere facilmente visitate a piedi e, a volte, questo è addirittura il modo più veloce e conveniente per raggiungere le vostre mete. Prima di lasciare l’ostello, fate le vostre ricerche e individuate quali sono le strade da percorrere per andare a vedere qualcosa in particolare o per fare un giro della città. Partire alla scoperta di una città è l’aspetto più eccitante di un viaggio con gli amici, e non ci sarà nessuno a costringervi ad entrare in un museo.

Buon viaggio!

preview.text: COME VIAGGIARE IN MODO INTELLIGENTE SENZA SPENDERE UN CAPITALE

render.text:
5 FEMALE RAPPERS THAT ARE TAKING OVER THE GAME

 

The future is female! Women are slowly claiming their space in even the most traditionally male-dominated fields. That is also the case for music genres like Hip Hop and Rap, traditionally “tough” to prove to yourself within. Even though women are not new to the hip hop scene, female rappers were usually outcasts if you take aside a few stand-alone heroines, who paved the way for the female rap super stars that dominate the scene today. Time to take a look and find out what is the secret to their fame and how that changes things for everyone.

 

M.I.A.

Mathangi "Maya" Arulpragasam better known as M.I.A is anything but a newcomer. Her stage name (short for: Missing in Action) already indicates that she is an artist who has a lot to say and who is not afraid to take a stand. The political and social issues she cares about are an important part of her music as well as her visual art. She's a megastar way beyond the hip hop and rap scene and her audience often is as mixed as the music she samples on her tracks. With her fifth studio album “AIM” she manifested herself as more than an artist and a musician, but an outspoken advocate for the things she believes in and fuel her creativity.

NICKI MINAJ

We owe this amazing woman so much! Not just for her hot beats but also for making the color pink cool again! She's the perfect combination of pop star and talented MC who's never afraid to demonstrate her artistry if someone dares to question it. Her male colleagues jump at the chance of working with her and we, the fans, benefit from these awesome collaborations. Nicki is taking the style and fashion sense that's always been an essential part of the hip hop scene to a totally new level. Did you know, that she was the first female artist included on MTV's Annual Hottest MC List? She's a huge inspiration for women and girls all over the world who finally stand their ground, speak up and show their potential!

AZEALIA BANKS

The beginning of Azealia’s career couldn't be further away from Hip Hop. As a child she performed in a musical in her hometown New York City and tried to pursue an acting career. Finally she found her way into hip hop and began to write rap and R&B songs as a creative outlet. When she was only 17 she started releasing music via MySpace where a record company spotted her and signed her right away. Her music brings unconventional style mixes into the whole hip hop/R&B scene, but it's her strong, outspoken eccentric personality she is best known for.

IGGY AZALEA

The Australian rapper, singer, actress, songwriter, model and director knew early on that she wanted a career in hip hop. So at the sweet age of 16 she packed her bags and moved to the United States to make her dream come true. Her debut studio album "The new Classic" was a sensation and made her the first non-American female rapper to reach No. 1 on the R&B/Hip-Hop Charts. Fun fact: Even though she's from Australia she raps with a thick American accent ever since she first got involved in the Southern hip hop scene.

 

ANGEL HAZE

Originally from Detroit, Michigan, Raeen Roes Wilson grew up in a community that forbid her to wear jewelry, date, listen to music or talk to outsiders. When she was 16 her family moved to New York and she found her place in the local hip hop scene. From that time on nobody could stop her or order her to be quiet. Her debut album "Dirty Gold" was released in 2013 and last year she self-released her internet-album "Back to the Woods". The songs often focus on topics that concern young women like body image and gender equality. She's an LGBTQ rights activist and speaks openly about gender identity and queerness. Something that her male counterparty could definitely pick up from her!

CELEBRITY MUSIC BUBBLE TAROT

Take a look at our celebrity music bubble and find out what the future has in store for you! Whichever name you read first will give you clues about the exciting things that are gonna happen in your life.

M.I.A.

The self-confident rap artist known as M.I.A. is the ideal symbol for the things you'll need in the near future. Challenging times might be on your way but with the strength and will power that M.I.A. represents you'll be fine dealing with them one at a time. Speak your mind and don't be silent when you witness a situation that seems unfair to you. M.I.A. symbolizes justice and female empowerment!

ONEREPUBLIC

Your motto for the next weeks to come is: Everything's new! The American superstar just released a new record and the wind of change is in the air. Maybe the future awaits you with a new crush? Or it's time for a new outfit and a totally different style. It's also the perfect opportunity to incorporate new habits into your life like healthier food or a new exercise routine.

ELLIE GOULDING

ELLIE has a huge heart for charity and current social topics. In the near future your conscience will awake and things like climate change and animal protection will occupy your mind. You realize that humans are not the only creatures living on this planet and that we should do more to protect our beautiful earth. ELLIE constantly posts great film and book tips about the topic and is an amazing role model.

LADY GAGA

It's time to shine! You feel like a newborn and are bursting with energy. Time to set things in motion with the kind of boldness that LADY GAGA is known for. Your friends and family can't get enough of you! You'll get invitations to lots of hot parties and may have difficulties to keep up with your schedule. But LADY GAGA also has a talent to prioritize so she gets enough beauty sleep. Follow her example and you’ll be the star at every party!

SHAWN MENDES

SHAWN MENDES is busy touring the world and for you it's also time to take a nice trip. It's doesn't always have to be a trip around the world, you’d be surprised what a short get away over the weekend can do! A change of scenery will provide you with a fresh view on things. Take your best buddies and pack your bags. New inspiration and experiences are waiting for you!

KATY PERRY

It's time to grow up and make mature choices like KATY does. You are not getting along with someone? Now is the time to get over your differences and settle the dispute. You'll be calmer and realize that it's not worth to get upset over every tiny thing. KATY shows you how to be a grown-up without becoming boring. There is nothing wrong with letting out your crazy side from time to time.

THE WEEKND

No risk no fun. Now is the time to challenge your luck! Take your chances like THE WEEKND does, it will be worth it! If you're in love, take the first step. If you're working on a new project, now is the time to make concrete decisions. You only get so many chances in life to do something really great, which sometimes also means jumping into cold water. It'll work out, THE WEEKND lives on the lucky side of life.

DRAKE

Good news for your professional life: DRAKE is known or his motivation and enthusiasm and he will share his energy with you. Whether you are going solo or in a team, you will shine with your skills and kindness. Drake is the perfect idol for people who know what they want and know how to reach it – you just gotta go for it!

SELENA GOMEZ

Think that your life resembles a roller coaster from time to time? Don't worry, ups and downs are part of your life. SELENA knows that really well, which is why she doesn’t get down on herself when things are not going great. But within the next weeks, things will settle and calm down a bit more, which makes it the right time to rest and fuel up. Everything will run smoothly and you'll finally have enough time for yourself.

7 GREAT ALBUMS YOU MISSED IN 2016

The best albums of the year are not always the best-selling ones! Sometimes it's hard to keep up with all the releases but don’t worry – we kept an overview so you can sit back, relax, and put on our list of great albums that completely fell under the radar in 2016.

THE 1975 - I LIKE IT WHEN YOU SLEEP, FOR YOU ARE SO BEAUTIFUL YET SO UNAWARE OF IT

THE 1975 deserve an award for the album title of the year! Seriously, can it get more romantic than that? The quartet from England knows how to put us into a great mood. They mix Alternative Indie Rock with Pop and sound like they've always been a part of the indie rock scene, even though ILIWYSFYASBYSUOI (even the shortcut of this title is long) is only their second release. If you've missed it so far, give it a listen right now!

JAMES BLAKE - THE COLOUR IN ANYTHING

Another talent from the island. Singer, songwriter and producer JAMES BLAKE from London was at the forefront of the dubstep movement a couple of years ago. You can still hear parts of it as influence on songs of THE COLOUR IN ANYTHING, even though he mixes all kinds of styles. R&B meets electronic pop with his soulful voice bringing lots of emotions into play. The perfect tunes for everyone who loves honest, emotional music that feels truly personal. One of our favorite tracks to really dive into James Blake’s music is “I Need A Forest Fire”.

MYSTERY JETS - CURVE OF THE EARTH

This is the perfect Christmas gift for all indie rock lovers. The cute guys from London are anything but new in the business – CURVE OF THE EARTH is their fifth studio album already and they haven’t lost any of their musical drive. Our listening tip: "Bubblegum". But be warned: The sound of the British rockers might get stuck in your head! The beautiful yet eerie video is also worth watching!

MICHAEL KIWANUKA – LOVE & HATE

When MICHAEL KIWANUKA starts singing, time stops. The British soul musician started out as a session guitarist and supported big stars on tour. Now he is back with his second solo album, that quickly became No. 1 in his home country. We don't get why it wasn't on top of the charts around the world! Especially the single "Black Man in A White World" can't be more relevant in 2016. It makes us dance at once and proves that a great voice doesn't have to sing ballads to give us goosebumps!

ESPERANZA SPALDING - EMILY'S D+EVOLUTION

This woman has a lot of talent! When she was only five years old she already played the violin in the Chamber Music Society of Oregon and was known as a musical prodigy. The American jazz bassist, cellist, singer and lyricist released her fifth studio album this year. EMILY'S D+EVOLUTION was co-produced by herself and star producer Tony Visconti! Contemporary Jazz meets Funk and Art Rock. For all music lovers who are interested in the unusual and extraordinary, this is the album you have been waiting for! Here’s the first single “Unconditional Love”.

THE AVALANCHES - WILDFLOWER

Nine years in the making THE AVALANCHES finally released their second album WILDFLOWER. After the success of their debut "Since I Left You" from 2000 the electronic music group from Australia needed time to perform and to find out what they wanted to do. What started out as Ambient World Music turned into Electronic with influences from Neo-Psychedelia, Disco and Hip Hop – very unlike anything you've ever heard! Samples combined with live music create a real unique sound that makes your head spin around. Don't try to analyze, give yourself to the music and enjoy! Their second single “Because I’m Me” also comes with an adorable video.

7 EASY MEALS YOU CAN MAKE IN A MUG

 

Whether you’re looking for a quick breakfast to eat on-the-go, or you just can’t be bothered doing the dishes tonight, mug snacks are the perfect solution to all your problems! Not only are they easy, but they are quick and require little cleaning and few ingredients. The only must-haves are a mug and a microwave - and the ingredients you’ll most likely have in the cupboard! So start using your mugs for something much more satisfying than coffee:

Oatmeal in a mug

Ingredients:

½ cup rolled oats 1 tablespoon ground flax seed 1 egg ½ cup almond milk (or normal milk) ⅓ of a medium banana, mashed ¼ teaspoon cinnamon 2 teaspoons maple syrup ⅓ cup fresh berries


Directions:

Spray your (microwave-safe mug) with cooking spray and mix in all ingredients Microwave on high for 2-3 minutes (check after about 2 mins to see how it’s going) Stir in extra milk or yogurt if it’s too thick. Enjoy warm!

Pizza in a mug (yes, pizza!)

Ingredients:

4 tablespoons all purpose flour A pinch baking powder A smaller pinch baking soda A pinch salt 3 tablespoons milk 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 tablespoon pizza sauce 1 small handful shredded mozzarella cheese Toppings of your choice (e.g. pepperoni, ham, mushroom, peppers) ½ teaspoon dried Italian herbs (basil or oregano are best)


Directions:

Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt together in your mug Add in the milk and oil with mix together (lumps are okay!) Spoon on the pizza sauce and spread it around the surface of the dough Sprinkle on the cheese, your chosen toppings and dried herbs Microwave for around 1.5 minutes, or until it rises up and the cheese is bubbling. Enjoy nice and hot!


Banana bread in a mug


Ingredients:

3 tablespoons flour 2 tablespoons brown sugar Pinch of baking powder Pinch of cinnamon 1 egg 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 tablespoon milk 1 ripe banana, mashed

Directions:

Spray your mug with cooking spray and mix in flour, sugar and baking powder. Add egg and combine. Mix in oil, milk and mashed banana Microwave on high for up to 3 minutes (check after about 1.5 mins and continue as necessary) Enjoy your banana creation warm with some cinnamon sugar on top!

Mac and cheese in a mug

Ingredients:

1/3 cup pasta 1/2 cup water 1/4 cup milk 1/2 cup shredded cheese

Directions:

Put the pasta and water in a large mug or bowl and microwave on high for 2 minutes, then stir (the water may overflow, just watch for this or use a bigger bowl) Repeat this for 2-4 more minutes, stirring in between until the pasta is cooked through (cook longer if needed) Remove the pasta from the microwave and stir in the milk and cheese. Microwave for another minute. Stir the cheese thoroughly into the pasta and voilà!

Meatloaf in a mug


Ingredients:

2 tablespoons milk 1 tablespoon ketchup 2 tablespoons quick-cooking oats 1 teaspoon onion soup mix 100g lean ground beef

Directions:

In your mug sprayed with cooking oil, combine the milk, ketchup, oats and soup mix. Spread the beef over mixture and mix well Cover and microwave on high for 3 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Drain the liquid from the mug Let the mug stand for about 3 minutes. Serve with additional ketchup if desired!


Scrambled eggs in a mug


Ingredients:

2 eggs 1 tablespoon milk or water Handful shredded cheese Sliced ham (turkey or bacon is also fine) Chopped onion, peppers, tomato, avocado or anything else you have lying around!

Directions:

Mix the eggs and milk in your mug and microwave for 1 minute to partially cook the eggs Add the ham, cheese and chopped vegetables Microwave for another 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt cheese and thoroughly cook eggs. Serve with toast for the perfect breakfast!

Lasagna in a mug

Ingredients:

2 pasta lasagna sheets ¾ cup water 1 teaspoon olive oil 3 tablespoons pizza sauce 4 tablespoons ricotta cheese 3 tablespoons fresh spinach 2 tablespoons cooked sausage or minced meat 1 tablespoon grated cheddar cheese

Method:

Roughly break the pasta sheets and place in a large mug Cover with water and olive oil (to stop the lasagna sticking together while cooking) Microwave for 3-4 min or until the pasta is tender (check it after a few mins and stir) Once cooked, drain the cooking water and remove the pasta from the mug Add 1 tablespoon pizza sauce and spread on the bottom of your mug Then create a layer of pasta, layer of spinach, meat and ricotta Repeat the layers all the way to the top of the mug then sprinkle cheese on top Place in the microwave and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the lasagna is heated through. Let cool for a couple minutes (it will be very hot) and bon appetit!

Molte persone amano ballare, ma solo alcune sono nate per farlo. Osservando Emil Rengle in azione, si capisce che lui è tra queste persone. A soli 24 anni, Emil è il coreografo ufficiale di The Voice Romania e di numerose star e artisti della musica pop internazionale.

preview.text: C’è la danza e poi c’è Emil Rengle.

render.text:
THE 7 BEST COLLABORATIONS OF 2016

What’s better than your favorite artists getting together to create inspire one another? Double the talent often equals double the fun! We tell you what collaborations have been the most fruitful in 2016 – let’s hope these teams weren't just a once in a lifetime occurrence.

RIHANNA (FEAT. DRAKE) - WORK

We love everything Riri does, guilty as charged! Of course her collaboration with cutie DRAKE can't be missed on any hot list this year. WORK is a great reggae-pop song that incorporates her roots in Dancehall. Once again RIHANNA demonstrates the capacity of her voice that fits perfectly to DRAKE'S R&B vocals. A match made in heaven, which can be also seen in the two(!) videos they shot for the song. These two have known each other for years and it's not the first time they're collaborating, which makes us ask: What's the current status? Is it really just work?

DESIIGNER (FEAT. KANYE WEST) - TIIMMY TURNER (REMIX)

At only 19 years old Sidnes Royel Selby III a.k.a. DESIIGNER has already made a name for himself. The New Yorker hip hop artist presents us a Trap, Horrorcore song that sticks. The official remix features production and voice from KANYE. Did you know that the title is a reference to a cartoon character? Timmy Turner from "The Fairly Odd Parents" has fairy godparents that grant him every wish. Unfortunately, these wishes turn out to have strange, unpredictable side effects Timmy has to deal with.

ARIANA GRANDE (FEAT. LIL WAYNE) - LET ME LOVE YOU

ARIANA is a grown, dangerous woman, and she’s eager to show us! Good for us, because we can't get enough of her talents and her unique voice. It spans a stunning four octaves! For LET ME LOVE YOU she went into the studio with no other than mega star LIL WAYNE. Fans were smitten by the result: cool hip-hop beats with a laid back R&B melody, stuttered vocals in the chorus and LIL WAYNE and ARIANA at their absolute best!

PUSHA (FEAT. JAY Z) - DRUG DEALERS ANONYMOUS

The 39-year-old American rapper is not only a hip hop artist but also president of Kanye Wests record company. He started his career as part of a duo, together with his brother, until they both decided that it was time to follow their own path. For DRUG DEALERS ANONYMOUS superstar JAY Z came on board. The hip hop track is great to chill, with a slow-paced beat and a homey feeling to it. The two super stars show us how great they can be when they join forces!

KANYE WEST (FEAT. CHANCE THE RAPPER) - ULTRALIGHT BEAM

We are used to KANYE being the center of attention but with ULTRALIGHT BEAM he is in the spotlight for what he does best: great music. This song is about his faith and he sings about his love for god. The rap from CHANCE THE RAPPER brings the Hip Hop back into this laid back gospel track. For us, this is one of the most original tracks of this year.

JAMES BLAKE (FEAT. BON IVER) - I NEED A FOREST FIRE

One of the most original songs this year and nobody seems to have noticed. Why? JAMES BLAKE and BON IVER created an amazing track that tears down the barriers between Folk, Electronic and Gospel. The great teamwork between the British singer-songwriter and the American indie folk band was released on JAMES BLAKE album "The Colour in Anything". We couldn't get "I need a forest fire" out of our heads for weeks, which goes to show that a collab between those two was long overdue.

KANYE WEST (FEAT. KENDRICK LAMAR) - NO MORE PARTIES IN L.A.

We know: KANYE again? Well, he was a busy bee this year and the list wouldn't be complete without NO MORE PARTIES IN L.A. In the second half he raps "the writer's block is over", doesn't look like writer’s block to us! This time Kanye brought on KENDRICK LAMAR to support him on this track. The lyrics are mocking the lifestyle of Hollywood’s rich people. It's their first collaboration and hopefully not their last.
